modules.description: This module defines a polymorphic type `t` representing various sidebar elements like active links, dividers, plain links, text, and raw HTML. It provides a function `t` to construct a sidebar component with a title and a list of these elements. Useful for rendering navigation sidebars in web applications with mixed content and interactive links.

Constructs a complete HTML page with a top navigation bar, wrapping provided content in a standard layout. Works with `Cow.Html.t` values to generate structured HTML output. Useful for rendering blog or documentation pages with consistent navigation and styling.

This module defines link structures as tuples of labels and URIs, providing functions to render them into HTML navigation components. It supports creating individual links with optional classes, horizontal top navigation bars aligned left or right, button groups, side navigation menus, and bottom navigation bars. These functions are used to generate structured, styled HTML output for web interfaces based on a list of labeled links.

This module provides functions to handle common HTTP response scenarios, including successful responses, not-found errors, and redirects. Each function takes a message formatter and a string argument, producing a formatted result. It is used to standardize response generation in web applications, particularly when dispatching routes or handling client requests.

This module constructs HTML components for blog layouts. It provides functions to format individual blog posts with titles, authors, dates, and content, as well as to assemble complete blog pages with titles, sidebars, and copyright notices. Use it to generate static blog pages from HTML fragments.

This module defines a blog entry structure with fields for update date, authors, subject, permalink, and body content. It provides functions to generate permalinks, compare entries, and convert entries to HTML or Atom feed formats. Use cases include rendering blog posts in web pages or generating Atom syndication feeds.

This module aggregates content from blog, wiki, and links feeds into unified HTML or Atom output. It provides functions to extract metadata like feed icons and URIs, convert entries to Atom format, and render HTML summaries with optional entry limits. Use cases include generating a combined news feed page or an Atom syndication feed from multiple content sources.

This module handles HTTP request dispatching with functions to split URL paths and parse headers into key-value pairs. It supports route handling by transforming URIs into structured responses like HTML pages, redirects, or error messages. It is used to implement web servers where URI paths map to specific content types or actions.

This module provides functions to construct HTML components for web interfaces, including navigation links, sidebars, blog layouts, and complete page templates. It works with `Cow.Html.t` values and tuples representing labeled links to generate structured, styled output. Concrete use cases include rendering navigation bars, sidebars with active links, and full HTML pages for blogs or documentation sites.

This module provides predefined HTTP header lists for common content types such as HTML, JSON, and PNG. Each value represents a set of headers suitable for use in HTTP responses to indicate content type and encoding. It is used to simplify the construction of HTTP responses with standard media types.

This module manages wiki entries and generates ATOM feeds and HTML content. It handles data types like `entry` with fields for author, date, subject, and body, which can be either a file or HTML. Functions support rendering HTML from entries, comparing dates, generating permalinks, and converting entries to ATOM feed format.

This module defines date-related types and conversion functions. It provides structured date representations with fields for month, day, year, hour, and minute, and includes functions to convert dates to HTML and XML formats. It supports use cases like generating formatted dates for web content or serializing dates in markup.

This module processes blog entries for rendering in HTML or Atom feed formats. It provides functions to convert a list of entries into an HTML fragment or a fully formed Atom feed, using a provided feed configuration. It also includes a function to generate a sidebar listing of recent posts, optionally filtered by an active category.

This module represents and processes Atom feeds, providing functions to construct and manipulate feed metadata and entries. It works with custom types for feeds and authors, integrating HTML parsing and Lwt for asynchronous entry reading. Concrete use cases include generating feed documents, extracting entry content from URIs, and handling author and metadata fields in web applications.

Handles link-based content in a feed system with structured metadata. It defines types for streams and links, supporting operations to convert links to Atom feed entries, compare entries, and generate permalinks. Used to manage and serialize blog or news links into standardized Atom feeds.

Constructs HTML document bodies and full pages with optional Google Analytics integration. Accepts HTML fragments for headers and content, and generates valid HTML5 output. Useful for rendering dynamic web pages with metadata and script inclusions.

This module provides functionality for building and rendering structured web content, handling HTTP request routing, and generating Atom feeds. It works with custom types for blog entries, wiki pages, links, and feeds, along with HTML fragments and HTTP headers. Concrete use cases include serving dynamic blog pages, aggregating content from multiple sources into a unified feed, and dispatching HTTP requests to generate HTML or Atom responses.
